answerText: imprinting [accept genomic imprinting][10] The expression of imprinted genes is usually silenced as a result of this process, which usually occurs at CpG sites. Riggs and Holliday proposed a form of this process which occurs de novo and then propagates itself.
heading: MUT |2012 | 3 | 13 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The chromosomal form of this phenomenon involves the complete silencing of genes on either maternal or paternal chromosomes, and can lead to Angelman and Prader Willi syndromes. For 10 points each: [10] Name this term, which also names the phenomenon studied by Konrad Lorenz in which organisms like greylag geese learn certain behaviors by observing the first instance of that behavior during a critical period.
